organic_results.title: Friendship patterns in open and traditional classrooms
organic_results.snippet: This paper questions the appropriateness of generalizing traditional sociometric findings to alternative types of classrooms. It is argued that organizational characteristics of the classroom which permit a high level of interaction among the students affect the patterns of children's friendship choices. Cross-sectional sociometric data from 51 classes and longitudinal data from 9 classes are examined to test the hypothesis that friendship patterns vary according to whether classrooms are" open" or" traditional." A less hierarchized …
